title: Depends on color/collar big
review_text: I initially bought this in blue because it looked like it could be a “safe” color. For the $3 price, I was concerned the colors may be neon, even though not described that way. The blue is a bit neon for public wear, the collar is big and it looked frumpy on me, so I didn't like it, but my mom liked it as a PJ top, so we ordered other colors at the price. We've been pleasantly surprised by the green, purple and especially the WHITE!!! The fabric feels very close to a regular tshirt, but it doesn't wrinkle and it doesn't look like polyester or spandex (on the white one, in particular). The red and blue are much cheaper looking because of the “neon” look of the colors in person. The red is more of a Christmas red - a slight orange tint. I highly recommend the white (5 stars). Others are ok: Green %26 purple (3.5 stars). Blue %26 red (3 stars if you just wear them around home. 1.5 stars if you expect to add them to your wardrobe.) We got the black, but I don't think I've seen it on her yet and I can't find it for the pic or review.

title: Sizing??
review_text: I normally wear a medium I'm going to return and order a larger size. It fits a little too snug for me. Matter of taste!!!

title: Easy Soft Outfit
review_text: like easy soft outfit while recovering from surgery soft went up on size
Material comfortable. Shorts are a bit shorter possibly for a plus size older woman.
These run small so I suggest getting a half size larger than normal. Don't expect to tie them as the laces are short

title: Win some... lose some...
review_text: I originally ordered 2 different styles of 'Crocs' and a pair of leopard print shoes, ordering according to the measurements of my feet, size 8 - 8%261/2. The shoes did fit okay. The 'Crocs' turned out to be much too large. One was not in the pattern as pictured. So, I ordered another pair of each style of 'Crocs' in size 7. One was sent in the correct size which I am keeping. This style, which I am reviewing was sent in a size 11... way too large... but in the same pattern as originally pictured!!! Now I have to go through the process of returning things... ugh!!!
I'm returning this brand, as I've also purchased the original Crocs from Walmart. I would prefer to stick with the Crocs I know after seeing this brand.

title: Run large
review_text: These are good for what I bought them for (shoes to wear when we have to go to the dump), but they run very large and will slip off if you do a lot of walking in them. I don't think they would be good for yard work or marine environments. The pink is a true light pink, not a coral pink as it appears on the screen. This actually was a nice surprise as I prefer true pink. They are very light.

The lining rolls when the slipper is put on. Also, it was a good idea for me to order a larger size so I could wear socks in the winter since the top snags on the top of my foot. Had I ordered my normal size I would not be able to get the slipper on.

don’t really mean to sound condescending but the box came like it went through WWII, other than that, shoes are comfortable and it is what the picture says it is. depending on ur shoe size, keep ur size on the order— since it’s true to size but it runs a tiny bit large

title: Get what you pay for!
review_text: Got the product on sale for Black Friday deals- wanted the “Pawz” brand but they weren’t on sale. The shoes are super light and not very sturdy. The back heel part isn’t high enough so I have to walk weird so the shoes don’t slip off since they are also fuzzy inside(which is fine)

title: Not cushiony and too stiff
review_text: They look great on the ad and in person, but they are too stiff, not pliable, and the bottom of the slipper is too flat, not at all cushiony. They do provide warmth to my feet and that is the reason I am keeping them.

title: Fall alert
review_text: The fit is fine except these shoes are a bit wide for my size medium shoe. I chose the black in 8/9 size. The soles are not slip proof or non slip even a little bit. Tho I tried to be careful when walking I did fall today while wearing these.

title: Found the exact same thing for less somewhere else
review_text: I was super excited when I saw these slippers for my daughter on sale pre-Black Friday. I thought the price seemed decent for what the photos showed. I placed my order and waited. Come to find out the product is not coming from a Walmart warehouse but in fact is coming from China directly. My package was delayed/delivered over a week later than originally stated. I waited until the week of Christmas to open the package and check out my purchase and man was I surprised. A few weeks back I had ordered what I thought were a similar pair of slipper for myself on T-E-M-U. They arrived and I opened them the same time I opened the Walmart set. I was beyond annoyed when my six dollar pair of slippers were the EXACT same size same as the set from Walmart that were three times as much. All of that being said, I will review the actual slippers themselves not the shady practices of the third party seller. The slippers are decently cute in person, not as nice looking as they were online. The bottom sole is very strange almost plastic. Would I knowingly purchase this same pair again? Probably not. I think I have had beater luck buying in store at Walmart or Sam’s Club and will go that route from now on.

title: Not worth $49.99 but cute sale item
review_text: These are cute and comfy but I felt obligated to leave a review after getting a “great deal” on Black Friday. I purchased for $16.99 regular price $49.99 and thought I got a great deal. They are cute but the quality is nowhere even close to being worth $50! These are fairly priced at $16.99 and I would never pay a penny more.

review_text: The actual slipper is fine. The lower rating comes from the pitch that they are suede. I assume that this material is a form of suede material but I was under the impression that they were made of genuine suede.

review_text: So these are nothing like the name brand ones. I have the name brand ones. But not these are fluffy and comfy. I won't wear them out but house shoes for sure.

I like the fact that it's got to be that burst when you were washing your face. I do, however wish that it made more foam so as to at least look like it's cleaning my face more than it is. I feel that it is not clean as well as it should especially for the price.

title: Clean
review_text: Ive used this duo so long that if I go to the store and they are(rare situation) out, I immediately order online once I return home if I only have a couple weeks of use left. I am now 61 years old and have no idea what else I'd trust to wash my face. My face feels smooth and not dry after I use it. Ive been using the day wash so long that it was with me through my teenage ache years and young broken heart when crying in the shower! So, to change from my favorite facial cleaner now, nah it is not in my plans!

title: Acne Battling Soap
review_text: I like that the beads help wash away dirt and oil from your skin BUT if you have naturally dry skin this will dry your skin out MORE. I recommend using a moisturizer after.

title: Why Your Seeing Certain Results
review_text: SO i have been seeing reviews that say they get a burning sensation from using the clean and clear morning burst face cleanser but that they are also using a brush with it. The reason that you are getting this burning sensation when you use the product is because you are ALSO using the brush. Cleaning you skin with a brush is also a method of exfoliation, which is NOT a bad thing EXCEPT for when you do that everyday. YOU DO NOT WANT TO BE EXFOLIATING EVERYDAY. I strongly recommend to only exfoliate once or twice a week because otherwise in the long run you will be taking a toll on your skin and you will be constantly removing skin cells everyday which will cause you skin to look more aged. The beads in this cleanser are already a gentle exfoliant.

title: Switched to this from different brand
review_text: I used a brand called Boscia for a few years but it never cleared my acne on my combo skin. I tried sample sizes of the morning burst and night relaxing now my skin is clear so I plan on buying full sizes. Strongly recommend a good moisturizer with these products.

title: Good and bad
review_text: When i started going back to school i got this product to feel refreshed and brighten my skin in the morning which it did. It feels soft on your skin and does what it says it does but i noticed i started to get red spots and blotchy skin. Sometimes it made my face itch and had a rash type of look on my cheeks and chin but that might just be my skin. It is good for its purpose but there are side affects.

title: Thumbs down for new formula
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using this product for my coarse colored hair for couple years now and it worked great in my asian bleached blond hair. Beside from smelling nice for so long it helped detangle my hair and made it so soft. However, they changed to a new formula and this new product looks like it thinner textured and my hair isn't as soft as it feels as the old product. The conditioner formula is even worse! The old conditioner had a rich texture and made my hair soft for days. This new product sucks, put it on seconds later and it turns to water like. Not worthing the money anymore

title: Gotta find a new shampoo after almost ten years...
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been dying my hair a fire engine red since high school. Ever since then, I have religiously used Wella shampoo and NOTHING else. Nearly ten years! It kept my hair vivid and healthy. When I ran out of my stockpile, I could only find Invigo everywhere, and gave it a try. Not only does it smell absolutely horrible, but my hair is waxy and I can SEE the color being shed from my hair in the shower. Really hoping they revert back to the old formula soon. Massively disappointing.

title: Bring back the old formula!!
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using the old formula for at least 7 years. It was the only shampoo/conditioner I had found that not only worked best for my hair, but had a pleasant and not overpowering scent. I am very sensitive to odors. I only use unscented deodorant, laundry soap, etc. I cannot tell you how this product works because I could not even use it. The scent is awful and too strong. I have returned the product and am on the search for a new shampoo. Please bring the old formula back. You have unfortunately lost a loyal customer. :(

title: A COMPLETE FIASCO
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wella Brillance was my holy grail shampoo for years. I usually buy 2 - 1L bottles at a time, so when I received these new ones I was disappointed that they changed completely - formula, smell, and bottle. As disappointing as this was I decided to give it a chance, perhaps the product was actually improved. After two weeks of almost daily use here's how it performed: - The smell is ok if you're into lime, but I'm not a fan. Part of the appeal of the original was how beautiful yet subtle the scent was. - It doesn't lather, I had to use 2X the amount of shampoo to get any decent lather - even then I had to shampoo twice. - My hair has become dull, dry and flat. - It's become incredibly static, it's unreal how much - if I run my hand down the side my hair just lifts up as if I'd rubbed a balloon on it. Just today I was having a conversation outside of my gym and as I was talking I moved my hair off my shoulder and it generated so much static my hair lifted up and then stuck all across my face. It was a little embarrassing, but I laughed it off. My overall experience is that this is one of the worst shampoos I've ever used. It seems as if Wella has essentially created a new product, discontinued an old one, and just piggybacked on the original products' positive reviews and high ratings. They really should have officially discontinued Wells Brilliance and created a new product entirely. It's a shame at what Wella has done with this product. This is a complete fiasco.

title: Where do I even start?
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using the Wella line of Brilliance Shampoo and Conditioner for fine hair faithfully for almost 2 years now and it has worked wonderfully. However, this new formula for Normal/Fine hair does not lather or retain color as well and it leaves my hair feeling hard/difficult to style. Also, the smell is not as pleasant. I'm sorry to say that although I have loved all the Wella products that I have used in the past, I cannot continue to use this new product formula and will be looking for a new line of Shampoo and Conditioner to try.

title: If the old brilliant formula was a 10+ this is 1
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used the old brilliant formula for 5+ years -perfect!It gave shine,depth,thickness and bounce. The new regrettably doesn't work and alarmingly seems to strip/fade colour near the roots.Please bring back the diamond dust formula.

title: Biotin Shampoo for hair growth
review_text: Biotin Shampoo for Hair Growth - Volumizing Shampoo for Hair Loss - Thin Hair Shampoo - 16 fl oz. Since turning 50 I've noticed thinning and some hair loss, I have only had this product for a couple weeks so I think it's too early to tell if it does what it claims to do - I hope so! I did have some nice volume after my initial use, this shampoo feels nice while using it (e.g. not greasy or goopy), has a very light scent and comes with a pump, contains no harsh chemicals or parabens per the label and not tested on animals.

title: Good bye to all the insects!
review_text: I have always wanted a screen door that was easy to open for my two year old to walk in and out. She plays with the sprinkler throughout the summer, and having the door closed is a headache because she cant walk in whenever she wants. Leaving it open is a headache as well, since all the flies and mosquitoes come in as they please. Installation was easy and quick, maybe 15 minutes. I noticed that the Velcro tape didn't stick very well to the paint I had at the door, so I added some staples. There is a lot of magnets down the middle, so it stays shut not allowing any insects in. I can now leave the door open to let fresh air enter without the bugs!

title: Not exactly what I expected.
review_text: The two units work as designed, but I felt the description was a little misleading when it stated always lighted. There is a program in place that automatically shuts the power off to conserve power. But the time between use is way to short and as far as I have been able to determine this is not adjustable. But these meet the basic need.

title: VEAT00L A9 ANC ENC touch screen fell out.
review_text: I purchased these VEAT00L A9 ANC ENC Earbuds with Smart Touch Screen on August 17th. I gave them to my wife, she really liked the sound and the fit was good. She put them back into the box and said " I will take them on our vacation trip in a few weeks". The week before we left on vacation (September) she got the earbuds out of the little charger box and was listening to them while we started packing, after a few minutes she said "what's wrong with the screen on the charger box?" I looked at it and the screen had fallen out in her hand. I understand these earbuds ain't Beats or Apple buds, but I didn't expect the touch screen to fall out before we really had a chance to use them. Maybe it didn't get glued in good at the manufacturer? I don't know... I have the VEATOOL T5 %26 V6 earbuds and they work very well with no issues so far.

title: A frustrating experience.
review_text: The location of the controls causes the music to repeatedly pause/play. Once I was FINALLY able to connect them to my phone (which was not an easy feat btw), I tried using them for 2 minutes and immediately put them back in the box to return them. The sound quality is great when you actually get to hear it.
The sound on his headphones is great, but the instructions for the different modes is not totally clear as to how to use them and how it works. Need a few more instructions .!

title: A few kinks
review_text: I ordered 2 of these ear buds within 2 weeks of each other. The 1st wouldn't charge which I found out the chargers in both did not charge the box it needs a stronger charger to charge it, so I sent the 1st one back the sound and everything was fine. I loved the earbuds but the 2nd one no one could hear me when I was talking so I couldn't use those at all for calls but if I wanna listen to music or something they will work perfectly fine. But I got ear buds for calls when I'm working I don't have to hold my phone on my ear. The bud covers are perfect they fit great holds awesome. The external noise is minimal and the sound is clear. I did not test the frequency range as I kept the box close on my arm or shirt with the string that comes with them you can attach to the box, which is the cooler part about the ear buds to me because I didn't have to put it in my pocket or hold it. All and all these could be the best ear buds but they have a few small kinks to master like the chargers and the volume that goes into the buds. Maybe I'll try them again if they bring out a updated version these.

I guess they were worth 18 I got them on clearance. but I kind of do what they want I'll be listening to them. then my phone will turn off go to Pause. are the volume will go down are it will skip to the next song. at first I thought it was just cuz I had to case in my pocket. but I put it on top of the dresser and it still keeps doing it I don't know what's up with him thought they'd be better
